dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4067 IH: Red Tape Reduction Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Hinson (for herself, Mr. Bishop of North Carolina, and Mr. Valadao) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Accountability, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To rescind the Executive order relating to the revocation of certain Executive orders concerning Federal regulation and to codify certain Executive orders.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Red Tape Reduction Act.

section.header: Repeal and codification of certain executive orders

subsection.text: The Executive order relating to the revocation of certain Executive orders concerning Federal regulation, signed on January 20, 2021, is hereby rescinded.
The following Executive orders shall have the force and effect of law:

paragraph.text: Executive Order 13771 (82 Fed. Reg. 12866; relating to reducing regulation and controlling regulatory costs).
Executive Order 13777 (82 Fed. Reg. 12285; relating to enforcing the regulatory reform agenda).
Executive Order 13891 (84 Fed. Reg. 55235; relating to improving agency guidance documents).
Executive Order 13892 (84 Fed. Reg. 55239; relating to transparency in administrative enforcement and adjudication).
Executive Order 13893 (84 Fed. Reg. 55487; relating to accountability for administrative actions).
